link.synopsis: This quirky black comedy stars Jeff Bridges as Nick Kegan, the younger brother of an American president who was shot and killed 19 years earlier. Now, a chance encounter with a dying man drives Nick to discover the truth behind the assassination. His eccentric megamillionaire father (John Huston) and his father's bizarre staff provide both help and hindrance, as do the oddball survivors of the era whom Nick meets during his quest.
link.title: synopsis
Triumph: Live at the US Festival
The Private Life of Sherlock Holmes

link.synopsis: Rainer Werner Fassbinder's 1976 movie, his first comedy, delves into the life of a writer (Kurt Raab) who firmly believes he's the reincarnated soul of a 19th century homosexual poet named Stefan George. Strapped for cash, he devises various plans to raise money -- most of which involve betraying women.
link.title: synopsis
The Bitter Tears of Petra Von Kant
Why Does Herr R. Run Amok?
The BRD Trilogy: The Marriage of Maria Braun
Otto; or, Up With Dead People

link.synopsis: Joey Slotnick, Paula Devicq (of "Party of Five" fame) and Brigitte Bako make up the love triangle in this 1997 romantic comedy. Jason (Slotnick) and Laura (Devicq) are engaged. Jason loves Laura, but everything gets muddled when his ex-girlfriend (Bako) suddenly comes back into his life. Also stars Molly Shannon (of "Saturday Night Live" fame).
link.title: synopsis
Hitler's Museum: The Secret History of Art Theft During World War II
Once Upon a Time in the Midlands

link.synopsis: Linus Roache stars as Perry in this quirky Australian comedy about a British paint exec who lives an otherwise colorless life but is obsessed with concocting the perfect paint color: Siam Sunset. In search of inspiration, he drives to the Australian desert. But along the way, he meets Grace (Danielle Cormack), who'll teach him that there's more to life than his job.
link.title: synopsis
Once Upon a Time in the Midlands

link.synopsis: Believe it or not, the wholesale pet supply business can be pretty tumultuous … and in Suckerfish, you'll see just how crazy it can be! When Dick (Tim Orr) and Alan (Dan Donovan), a pair of pet supply salesmen, wage war against another salesman, Ken (Kurt Bodden), all hell breaks loose in this black comedy.
link.title: synopsis
The Happy Hooker Goes to Washington / The Happy Hooker Goes Hollywood
He Died with a Felafel in His Hand
How to Kill Your Neighbor's Dog

link.synopsis: This rollicking, romantic musical comedy features the winning performance and wonderful songs of internationally acclaimed pop superstar Ofra Haza. A dance teacher turned matchmaker who searches the obituaries for promising prospects and a boy who pumps gas but wants to be a rock star are among the many memorable characters who populate this comic classic from the celebrated Hagashash trio.
link.title: synopsis
Jeopardy: An Inside Look at America's Favorite Quiz Show!

link.synopsis: This dark comedy about life, love and lies focuses on a quiet high school teacher, husband and father who sets out from his Jerusalem home for a trip to New York -- and is detoured by a midlife crisis to the Hotel California in Tel Aviv. A powerful, provocative film, Fictitious Marriage courageously confronts the myths of everyday existence with intelligence, insight and humor.
link.title: synopsis
Turn Left at the End of the World

link.synopsis: John Newcombe wrote, directed and stars in this romantic comedy as a Los Angeles ad executive who's sucked into the best man role at a wedding for a couple he doesn't know. When he and his girlfriend attend the event in the small Indiana town of Grass Creek equipped with a fake story about their relationship to the marrying couple, the situation turns into a funny, offbeat and profound experience. Megan Mullally (TV's "Will and Grace") co-stars.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: Weekend at Bernie's meets Friday in this wacky comedy when Jamal and Peanut cruise around Compton in their fly automobile. But they're accompanied by an unusual passenger in the backseat … one who's wrapped up in a sheet and isn't moving! It's just another messed-up day in the 'hood, albeit with tons of hilarious characters.
link.title: synopsis
Usher: Rhythm City: Vol. 1: Money, Power, Respect
Metallica: With the San Francisco Symphony: S&M

link.synopsis: Set in Madrid, Spain, this engaging comedy chronicles the complex relationship between single female Esperanza (Loles León), who can't buy a date, and her best friend Ramón (Andrea Occhipinti), a gay divorce attorney whose bed is never empty. The pair's friendship is put to the test when Esperanza introduces Ramón to her fellow teacher Roberto (Armando del Rio) -- who soon sends Ramón's life spinning out of control.
link.title: synopsis
Eating Out: All You Can Eat
The Other Side of the Bed
Tie Me Up! Tie Me Down!

link.synopsis: Brazilian director Sérgio Bianchi's bitterly sarcastic political comedy skewers race and class relations with witty precision as it presents a society in chaos. The quasi-documentary revolves around six characters that frequent a restaurant in São Paulo. They serve as a microcosm of modern Brazil -- a people beset by corruption, exploitation, sexual oppression and social discord.

To the Left of the Father
Love for Sale: Suely in the Sky
Blood and Wine: A Brazilian Story
Once Upon a Time in Rio
The Other Side of the Street

link.synopsis: A boy genius (Seth Adkins) discovers the meaning of friendship with the help of a chimpanzee called Clemens and its martial-arts expert owner (Matthew Modine) in this comedy directed by Gene Quintano. The boy agrees to assist the two in their battle against an evil animal laboratory -- in exchange for advice that'll help him gain the attentions of his school crush and play football like a jock.

link.synopsis: Kick Gurry, Maya Stange, Pia Miranda, Andy Anderson and Marton Csokas star in this coming-of-age musical comedy about a garage band in Sydney trying to make it in the music world -- but  their first concert fails miserably. The group's leader searches for the perfect person to manage and usher them to stardom, while everyone else in the band struggles to hang on to their dream. Alex Proyas (I, Robot) directs and co-writes.

link.synopsis: Ching-Ying Lam directs and stars in this weird mélange of martial arts, horror and comedy. Ying reprises his role as the sorcerer from this film's prequel, Mr. Vampire. This time around, he must protect a village when townspeople dig up a vicious vampire (in tandem with a vampire baby he's been harboring in secret!).

link.synopsis: It's been a year since Ed Chilton's mother passed away, and life just isn't the same. Eager to have her back, Ed (Steve Buscemi) turns to a company that, for a large fee, claims to be able to bring his mother back to life. But once she's back, Mom (Miriam Margolyes) starts acting very strangely ... and it seems her new habits of eating bugs and sleeping in the refrigerator are just the beginning. Ned Beatty co-stars in this quirky dark comedy.

link.synopsis: After America's ban against the immigration of Chinese women is lifted, Wah Gay (Victor Wong) sends his son (Russell Wong) back to China to find his betrothed (Cora Miao) in this delightful ethnic comedy about an arranged marriage gone awry. Though it's also a love match, when the couple returns to America, the challenge of making a living, adjusting to a new life and a womanizing gambler (Eric Tsang) threaten their union.

link.synopsis: Australian director Emma-Kate Croghan weighs in with this sly romantic comedy about a group of twenty-somethings living in Sydney, Australia. Judy (Claudia Karvan) is a young woman involved in an on-again, off-again relationship with Ewan. Beginning on New Year's Eve, the film follows Judy and her two best friends and Ewan and his two buddies as they try to establish their careers and find love -- or, at the very least, sex.

The Catherine Cookson Collection: The Glass Virgin

link.synopsis: This highly unorthodox black comedy from director Philippe Mora spins around a doctor attempting to cure the dementia of his patient (Angus MacFadyen) -- by forcing him to dress up as Adolf Hitler! Recruiting other patients to act as Hitler's henchmen (Joseph Goebbels, etc.) and even Eva Braun, the mad doctor concocts a scheme that has both disastrous and hilarious results.

link.synopsis: In this comedy adapted from Paul Rudnick's off-Broadway hit play, a young, gay actor/waiter (Steven Weber) finds "Mr. Right" after becoming celibate -- a move inspired by his fear of AIDS. Struggling with the notion of commitment after learning his perfect mate is HIV positive, he relies on his best friend (Patrick Stewart, as an interior decorator), and a hilariously lascivious priest (Nathan Lane) to help him find the way.

link.synopsis: In this outlandish Spanish comedy, Javier Bardem stars as an aspiring thespian who hones his technique over the fiber-optic cable as a phone-sex operator, thrilling the men and women of Madrid alike with his repertoire of exciting aliases. But just as his big break seems a foregone conclusion, a sexy caller embroils him in her plot to entrap her roving husband. And this time, his gift of gab may not be enough to save his bacon.

link.synopsis: Director Lewis Gilbert mines the comedy in this fish-out-of-water story about three men -- Rothwell, Mike and Dave (played by Todd Graff, Sam Robards and Bernard Strother) -- who go to a kibbutz to discover what Jerusalem is all about, only to come out very surprised. Mike, in particular, finds himself torn when he falls in love with an Israeli woman (Joanna Pacula) right before he has to go home.

When his father suffers a heart attack after losing at cards to a pretty gambler (Chung), a triad leader (Tam) seeks revenge and hires an alcoholic gunman (Leung) to do the job. But it appears the card shark has cheated another mob boss, so it's a race to see who can nab her first!

Fox) pursues Beth Franklin (Nancy McKeon) -- the girlfriend of a rich rival from a cooler clique -- and the fierce competition culminates in an auto race to settle things. A slew of television stars from the 1950s and '60s turn up in cameos, including Angela Cartwright, Dwayne Hickman, Elinor Donahue, Bob Denver and Tony Dow.

The episodes feature some of the best comedians in the business moonlighting as Glick's guests, including Steve Martin, Janeane Garofalo, Jerry Seinfeld, Dennis Miller and the always-hilarious Eugene Levy.

link.synopsis: Charismatic adman and notorious womanizer Ralph Gagante (Mark Feuerstein) decides to forsake his Casanova ways by going celibate after falling for brainy new co-worker Elizabeth Brenner (Amy Redford), who's turned off by his skirt-chasing. But all bets are off when Ralph's fantasy girl (Ali Larter) enters the picture in this audacious sex comedy from director Christopher Kublan. Dabney Coleman plays Ralph's chauvinist boss.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: A young couple marries, secure in the certainty that they'll spend the rest of their lives together. But when infidelity rears its ugly head (the man begins stepping out with other women), that compact is broken, and his wife decides that murder is the only way to remedy the situation. A titillating Spanish black comedy from director Carlos Carrera.

link.synopsis: After his wife leaves him, sound engineer Jacques (Jean-Pierre Bacri) unwittingly opens a new chapter in life by hiring inexperienced cleaning lady Laura (Emilie Dequenne) in this French romantic comedy. As Laura works to improve her housekeeping skills, the two become close ... until one day she moves in with him altogether.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: Continuing to focus on the trials, tribulations and triumphs of gay men in America, this collection of four short indie films tackles topics that are contemporary, controversial and sometimes comical. In "L.T.R.," a documentarian get a shock as he chronicles a budding romance; "O Beautiful" addresses gay bashing; and "This Car Up" follows the improbable coupling of an attorney and a bike messenger. The comedy "Bumping Heads" rounds out the video.

link.synopsis: Richard Benjamin directs and co-stars in this comedy written by Paul Rudnick. Lisa Kudrow plays the title character, Marci, the daughter of a record company honcho (Benjamin) who has to step in and tame a feisty rapper's (Damon Wayans) wild image after protesters boycott his latest CD. A jilted bridegroom is demanding to know why the doctor advised his bride to call off the wedding … but the doctor's has even bigger problems when he's faced with his own impotence.

link.synopsis: Three Canadian couples who appear to be sorely mismatched are on the way to the altar in this comedy. Noah (Benjamin Ratner) and Zipporah (Frida Betrani), an aspiring country singer, are headed down the aisle after only a 6-month courtship, much to the dismay of countless family members and friends. link.synopsis: Director Sandra Werneck's earnest romantic comedy -- winner of the 2001 Sundance Jury Prize for Latin American Cinema -- takes a unique approach to young love by posing multiple scenarios for main characters Carlos (Murilo Benício) and his girlfriend, Júlia (Carolina Ferraz). As Carlos waits for Júlia to arrive at a Rio de Janeiro movie theater, will one seemingly insignificant choice change his entire future?

link.synopsis: In this romantic comedy, competition knows no bounds when it comes to the pursuit of love. At the Cannes Film Festival (where sections of the movie were filmed), filmmaker Hal Raymond (Keith Carradine) meets alluring Maria Barone (Monica Vitti), whom he discovers is the wife of movie producer Federico Barone (Raf Vallone). link.synopsis: Shy, gay pushover Matt (Paul Denniston) enrolls in Butch Camp, where crazy dominatrix Samantha Rottweiler (Judy Tenuta) is charged with transforming her wimpy trainees into macho men. The arduous regimen culminates with a night out in the belly of the straight beast: a sports bar! But as Matt's self-confidence builds, he snags the attention of a beautiful woman and her boyfriend in this madcap gay comedy.

Along the way, Lulu tries to reignite their romance, and Ben's psychiatrist wife (Penelope Ann Miller) flies out to intercept them and win back her husband. John Kaye directs this romantic comedy.

The youngsters get caught up in the fun, but once part of the gang leaves, loyalties shift, leaving the two boys in conflicting positions. A unique coming-of-age comedy with deft narrative.

Capitalizing on the theme that high school is just a combat zone from which one must emerge alive, this dark comedy takes you to a place where shooting sprees and other bloody incidents are commonplace.

link.synopsis: Unhappy with their jobs as a chauffer and a low-level modeling agency employee, a father and son open their own agency in South Beach. Soon they're interacting with a host of gorgeous women dying to become models in this trendy town. Plenty of high jinks ensue in this sexy comedy, as the beautiful babes compete for jobs, fend off unwanted attention from lusty would-be suitors and romp poolside in their tiny bikinis.

link.synopsis: For the first time ever, film buffs can view Seven Years of Bad Luck, entertainer Max Linder's 1921 comedy, along with a handful of short films and excerpts collected here, accompanied by a score devised from music of that period. Known for his unmistakable slapstick style that influenced many comedians, including such luminaries as the Marx Brothers, Linder plays for laughs using a broken mirror frame as a prop.

link.synopsis: Known around the world for his zaniness, bawdy behavior, buffoonery and mastery of slapstick, Benny Hill was one of the first great television comics. His humor and unique style defined television comedy for a generation and have been emulated by endless comics for decades. His timeless moments and some of his most famous sketches -- including his repertoire of songs -- are captured here, in all their &NFi;Hill&NFi_;-arilty.

link.synopsis: In this Hong Kong comedy, two young male police officers discover an all-female cop district headed by the sexy Mona Lui (Carina Lau) and immediately make it their business to get assigned to this enticing precinct. But when a crazy criminal tries to blow up the police station in question, the guys wonder if their self-serving decision will end up costing them a bit more than they'd bargained for.

link.synopsis: Set in a Brisbane pizza parlor, City Loop is a night in the life of a group of confused youths whose lives are falling apart. From a virgin who's determined to change her circumstances to a girl whose crush might actually be gay to a paranoid co-worker, this gritty romantic comedy presents a series of humorous yet sincere situations that capture just how difficult it is to make the transition into adulthood.

link.synopsis: Veteran thespian Utpal Dutt stars as Chaudhry, a landowner who comes to town looking to get his daughter Sunita (Zarina Wahab) married to the son of his childhood friend Khanna. Khanna's son, Jai (Farooque Shaikh), isn't interested in marrying anyone, but his determined father nonetheless plans a trip to Chaudhry's village for Jai, hoping things will work out. What ensues is a hilarious comedy of errors.

link.synopsis: When daffy bellboy Melvyn Orton (Bronson Pinchot) accidentally switches the itinerary envelopes for three hotel guests (a Mafia hit man, a timid realtor and a vacationing lothario who's just been set up on a blind date with a sexy woman), he inadvertently gives them travel plans they'll never forget. Bryan Brown, Richard Griffiths, Patsy Kensit, Andreas Katsulas and Dudley Moore co-star in this wacky comedy.

link.synopsis: Walter Matthau stars in three charming vignettes -- each set in room 719 of New York's Plaza Hotel -- that make up this classic comedy. Matthau plays a cheating husband, a Hollywood producer and a father of the bride.

Two radical journalists, Andy Hobart (Tony Roberts) and Norman Cornell (Todd Susman), find themselves angling for the affections of their new neighbor, Amy Cooper (Sandy Duncan), a patriotic, would-be Olympic athlete whose ideological position is worlds away from theirs.

link.synopsis: To nab photos of a politician's daughter in a compromising position, a salacious tabloid hires two buddies (Jimmy Fallon and Brian Hooks) in this hilarious comedy. Sounds like a simple enough task, except that these would-be shutterbugs are notoriously incompetent. So, it's anyone guess whether they'll manage to shoot the pictures … or botch the scheme like they always do!

link.synopsis: About to part ways for the rest of their lives, two best friends decide to go on one last snowboarding trip together. While enjoying the freedom of the great outdoors, the two guys tear up the slopes and test the limits of their friendship. Shot on location at scenic Mammoth Mountain in California, this low-budget comedy from director Jeremy Gosch stars Todd Malta, Mark L. Taylor and Anne Lockhart.

link.synopsis: This 1979 British comedy starring Bartlett Mullins and Peggy Ann Clifford is a time capsule unleashed, a perfect study of the 1970s era's dated attitudes toward women -- but a highly entertaining adventure nonetheless. Four vignettes feature husbands whose willpower and fidelity are tested when four alluring women attempt to seduce them.

link.synopsis: Centered on a hyper-dysfunctional family beset with issues of resentment, homophobia, debauchery, incest and even bestiality, director Francois Ozon's (8 Women) provocative black comedy undermines every convention its generic title might suggest. When the father of a typical middle-class family brings home a pet rat, the simple act kicks off a disastrous chain of events that threatens to destroy the lives of the unassuming suburbanites.

link.synopsis: This sexy comedy has no shame and throws more Hong Kong-style martial arts your way than a 24-hour "Kung Fu" TV marathon! Our heroine, Brittany Sears, must overcome her phobia of acceleration to win a race and save her friends from a crazed drug lord. And with the help of speed racer Max Spears and a kindly Shaolin warrior who kicks butt, she just may do it.

link.synopsis: Hop on the boogie board and get ready for a gnarly ride in this sunny beach-blanket comedy starring Gabrielle Anwar, Traci Bingham, Loretta Swift, Bronson Pinchot and Douglas Spain. Three rich dudes move into a mansion and expect to score women by the dozen. But first, they must learn how to surf. Life's truly a beach when you give in to the waves, because there's nothing more radical than falling in love.

link.synopsis: In director Lina Wertmüller's upbeat comedy, Marco Sperelli (Paolo Villaggio) -- a priggish upper-class teacher from northern Italy -- is mistakenly assigned to a tumbledown school in an impoverished village near Naples. But upon arriving, he finds most of his students hustling on the streets to earn money for their families -- and before you can say "school of hard knocks," Sperelli becomes the pupil as the kids tutor him about life's realities.

link.synopsis: Comedy writer Bruce Vilanch -- an outsize talent if ever there was one -- is the subject of a scintillating documentary that asks the question: Are comics naturally funny? In Bruce's case, it's a resounding "Yes." Vilanch has written socko material for "Hollywood Squares" and the Oscar, Emmy, Tony and Grammy awards shows, as well as one-liners for Bette Midler and Whoopi Goldberg, among others. When in trouble, celebrities just say, "Get Bruce!"

link.synopsis: In this comedy of errors, a seedy journalist, Carrie (Sammi Cheng), leaves her cheating boyfriend, Raymond, and later befriends a macho cop whom she discovers is impotent as a result of an injury he received while on the job. But love persists in spite of all the challenges, and soon, Carrie discovers she has feelings for her wounded friend.

The object of his affection is Maggie (Maggie Cheung), who's traveling with her friend Agnes. Can a cantankerous mechanic win over a rich girl's heart? With the help of his friends, maybe Fred can.

link.synopsis: A modern-day couple, Joseph (Eric Stoltz) and Sarah (Meg Tilly), discovers there's room for a third person in their marriage in this unusual romantic comedy. Joseph's best friend, Frank (Craig Sheffer), is in love with Sarah, too, and no matter how much he tries, he can't get over her. The film features a flat-out funny Quentin Tarantino (who co-wrote parts of the movie) in the dinner party scene. Adrienne Shelly and Parker Posey co-star.

link.synopsis: Danny (Greg Kinnear) is happily married to Jennifer (Lauren Holly), the love of his life. But there's one hitch: No matter how hard -- and often -- they try, they can't seem to conceive a child. All kinds of hilarious fertility therapy procedures ensue in this romantic comedy. Matters are not helped by Danny's hanky-panky with a co-worker, Lindsay (Jill Hennessy). Joan Cusack and Jay Thomas co-star.

Be it the pharmacy student who spends his time concocting date-rape drugs or the scoundrel who secretly videotapes co-eds, these guys are anything but model students.

link.synopsis: Funnyman Tim Conway stars as lovable doofus Dorf in this twin bill of comedy shorts in which his pint-sized alter ego demonstrates his passion for bingo and tries his hand at a variety of Olympic sports. Dorf shows viewers the proper way to daub and yell "Bingo" and then puts his discus-throwing skills to the test -- with humorous results, of course. Co-stars Vincent Schiavelli and Chuck McCann add to the lunacy.

link.synopsis: Tim Conway's vertically challenged alter ego, Dorf, takes on two different sports in this double feature of, er, short comedy films (no pun intended) that includes Dorf Goes Auto Racing (1990) and Dorf on the Diamond (1996). First, renowned European race-car driver Duessel Dorf tests his mettle on American soil. Then, while sitting in the stands at an all-star East-West baseball game, Dorf daydreams about what it would be like to be a coach.
